flow.informationArchitecture: Program overview → scope & focus → reward structure by vulnerability level & asset type → eligibility requirements; external platform for submissions

Proof of concept requirement adds submission friction

copy.headline: Bug Bounty

microcopy.text: The PancakeSwap bug bounty program is focused around our smart contracts, websites, and apps with a primary interest in the prevention of loss of user funds, either by direct draining of locked funds or social engineering attacks by redirecting users or forcing them to sign a transaction.
microcopy.purpose: Defines scope and focus areas for eligible reports

microcopy.text: *All bug reports must include a Proof of Concept demonstrating how the vulnerability can be exploited to be eligible for a reward. This may be a smart contract itself or a transaction.

dataFormatting: Up to USD $1,000,000 — maximum bounty for Critical smart contract issues
Up to USD $20,000 — High severity smart contract bounty
Up to $2,000 — Medium severity smart contract bounty
trustSignals: High maximum bounty amount ($1M critical) signals serious security commitment
Partnership with established ImmuneFi security platform
Clear program focus on fund protection and user security

microcopy.text: We have a lovely chat about your target launch date, your goals for TGE, and your team decides to commit to an IFO - let's go!

flow.informationArchitecture: Categorical filters (Live/Old/Staked) at top, then sortable list with uniform card layout containing pool name, earning metrics (DN earned, total staked, APR), and time-to-end information
frictionPoints: APR copy button may be unclear to users unfamiliar with interface conventions
No indication of how to actually stake or add funds directly from card view
Time-limited pools (23 days, 79 days) may create pressure without clear deadline explanations
progressIndicators: Countdown timer (Ends in 23 days, 79 days, etc.)
Earned amount display showing claimed rewards

copy.headline: Syrup Pools
copy.subheadline: Just stake some tokens to earn. High APR, low risk.

ctas.placement: Right side of each pool card

microcopy.context: Pool card label above earned amount
microcopy.purpose: Identify the reward token being earned
Show total capital locked in pool
Display annual percentage return; includes copy icon for sharing
Indicate time-limited nature and create urgency

dataFormatting: Earned: 0 (0 USD) — double display showing token and fiat value
Total staked: 750,666 Cake — large round numbers with token abbreviation
APR: 3.48%, 5.20%, 3.78%, 65.29% — percentages with optional copy icon
Ends in: 23 days, 79 days, 8 days — human-readable time durations
TVL-style metrics: 2,180,382 Cake — abbreviated to thousands where appropriate
trustSignals: High APR / low risk claim in subheadline (aspiration signal, not guaranteed)
Total staked amounts show pool capital commitment
Named pools (Earn DN, Earn U, Earn TYCOON, Earn Cake) indicate real, active products
emptyStateText: No pools shown if filters result in zero matches
